messageBody:
Hi all,

At Model N we've made a lot of extensions to JUnit. Over the next few weeks
I'll be posting several of them for the benefit of anyone else who wants to
use them. I would love to hear any feedback you have to give.

A common problem in testing a distributed system is interacting with
asynchronous services. For example, suppose you want to test that an email
message gets sent correctly, so you set up a local mailbox to test with.
You write a test case that should cause a message to be sent. But if you
check that mailbox immediately after sending, your test is bound to fail.

What everyone I've seen does is to tell their test case to go to sleep for
some hardcoded length of time before checking. But as conditions may vary
in multiple testing environments, this interval will have to cover even the
slowest possible case in order to avoid false negatives--and then everyone
suffers the delay.

What I think these test developers would really like to do is use a
RetriedAssert! Example:

new RetriedAssert(5000, 250) { // timeout, interval
public void run() throws Exception {
doSomeStuff();
assert(someCondition);
}
}.start();

You're free to muck it up however you wish, and there's a few test cases to
tell you if you mucked it up too much. :-)

<<RetriedAssert.java>> <<RetriedAssertTest.java>>
Kevin

P.S. Let me know if the attachments don't come through...
